meanings.definition: Defeated or overcome in battle or conflict.
meanings.sent1: The vanquished army retreated in defeat.
meanings.sent2: The soldiers mourned their vanquished comrades.
meanings.sent3: The vanquished knights decided to start a baking club.
meanings.sent4: The vanquished hopes lay shattered on the battlefield.
meanings.sent5: The image of the vanquished foe haunted his dreams.

meanings.sent1: The vanquished kingdom surrendered to the conquerors.
meanings.sent2: The vanquished dragon lay defeated at the hero's feet.
meanings.sent3: The vanquished cat refused to admit defeat and kept chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: The vanquished city stood silent under the rule of the invaders.
meanings.sent5: The vanquished spirit of the old king lingered in the castle.

meanings.sent1: The vanquished boxer struggled to stand after the knockout.
meanings.sent2: The vanquished ship sank beneath the stormy waves.
meanings.sent3: The vanquished puppy wagged its tail happily despite losing the game.
meanings.sent4: The vanquished forest lay silent after the storm passed.
meanings.sent5: The vanquished feeling of despair consumed her heart.
